dkeep.logic

Class Guard

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Character
      • dkeep.logic.Guard

  • public class Guard
extends Character
    Guard extends the Character class and implements a few of its abstract methods. One of the game's enemy types.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Guard(int guardX, int guardY, int guardMov)
      Constructs a new Guard given its X and Y coordinates and also an integer value to indicate its movement strategy.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getDisplayChar()
      Returns the char that is used to represent the guard.
      boolean isAdjacent(int X, int Y)
      Returns true if the Guard is adjacent to the (X,Y) position while also being awake.
      boolean isAsleep()
      Returns true if the guard is asleep and false otherwise.
      void move(char[][] table)
      Gets the direction the guard should move in according to its movement strategy and updates its position using that direction.
      void setAsleep(boolean asleep)
      Sets the guard's 'asleep' attribute to the parameter.
      void setStunned(boolean value)
      Abstract method that sets the character's 'stunned' attribute to 'value'.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Guard

        public Guard(int guardX,
             int guardY,
             int guardMov)
        Constructs a new Guard given its X and Y coordinates and also an integer value to indicate its movement strategy. A guardMov value of 1 means the guard's movement will be Rookie, 2 means Drunken and 3 means Suspicious.
        Parameters:
        guardX - guard's x coordinate
        guardY - guards's y coordinate
        guardMov - indicates the guard's movement strategy

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(char[][] table)
        Gets the direction the guard should move in according to its movement strategy and updates its position using that direction. This function is also responsible for making the guard asleep. When this happens, the guard will remain in its place.
        Specified by:
        move in class Character
        Parameters:
        table - char matrix that represents the level's table.
        See Also:
        Level, Guard, Ogre

      • isAsleep

        public boolean isAsleep()
        Returns true if the guard is asleep and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        boolean value that indicates if the guard is asleep

      • setAsleep

        public void setAsleep(boolean asleep)
        Sets the guard's 'asleep' attribute to the parameter. The 'asleep' attribute indicates if the guard is asleep.
        Parameters:
        asleep - the boolean value that 'asleep' will be set to

      • getDisplayChar

        public char getDisplayChar()
        Returns the char that is used to represent the guard. This char has two possible values because the guard may be awake or asleep.
        Overrides:
        getDisplayChar in class Character
        Returns:
        the guards's display char

      • isAdjacent

        public boolean isAdjacent(int X,
                          int Y)
        Returns true if the Guard is adjacent to the (X,Y) position while also being awake. Returns false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        isAdjacent in class Character
        Parameters:
        X - x value of the desired position
        Y - y value of the desired position
        Returns:
        boolean value that indicates if the Guard is awake and adjacent to the (X,Y) position
        See Also:
        Hero, Guard, Ogre

      • setStunned

        public void setStunned(boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Character
        Abstract method that sets the character's 'stunned' attribute to 'value'. The 'stunned' attribute indicates if the character is stunned.
        Specified by:
        setStunned in class Character
        Parameters:
        value - the boolean value that 'stunned' will be set to
        See Also:
        Ogre
